DataElement.preferredName: Gene Expression Level Immunohistochemistry Staining Method Finding Stain Intensity IntensityOfStain
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein.:A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.:Immunohistochemical staining techniques allow for the visualization of antigens via the sequential application of a specific antibody to the antigen (primary antibody), a secondary antibody to the primary antibody and an enzyme complex with a chromogenic substrate. The enzymatic activation of the chromogen results in a visible reaction product at the antigen site. The specimen may then be counterstained and coverslipped. Results are interpreted using a light microscope and aid in the differential diagnosis of pathophysiological processes, which may or may not be associated with a particular antigen.:Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom)._A dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.:The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling._Indicates the degree of strength of stains

The enzymatic activation of the chromogen results in a visible reaction product at the antigen site. The specimen may then be counterstained and coverslipped. Results are interpreted using a light microscope and aid in the differential diagnosis of pathophysiological processes, which may or may not be associated with a particular antigen.:Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom)._A dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.:The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Gene Expression Level Immunohistochemistry Staining Method Finding
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein.:A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.:Immunohistochemical staining techniques allow for the visualization of antigens via the sequential application of a specific antibody to the antigen (primary antibody), a secondary antibody to the primary antibody and an enzyme complex with a chromogenic substrate. Results are interpreted using a light microscope and aid in the differential diagnosis of pathophysiological processes, which may or may not be associated with a particular antigen.:Objective evidence of disease perceptible to the examining physician (sign) and subjective evidence of disease perceived by the patient (symptom).

Concepts.definition: Typically involves transcription of genetically encoded information into an intermediary message (messenger RNA) and subsequent translation into a functional protein.
A position on a scale measuring intensity, quality, or amount.

Immunohistochemical staining techniques allow for the visualization of antigens via the sequential application of a specific antibody to the antigen (primary antibody), a secondary antibody to the primary antibody and an enzyme complex with a chromogenic substrate. The enzymatic activation of the chromogen results in a visible reaction product at the antigen site. The specimen may then be counterstained and coverslipped. Results are interpreted using a light microscope and aid in the differential diagnosis of pathophysiological processes, which may or may not be associated with a particular antigen.
Clinical, laboratory or molecular evidence, or absence of evidence of disease.

Property.preferredDefinition: A dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.:The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

Concepts.definition: A dye or other coloring material that is used in microscopy to make structures visible.
The degree or magnitude of strength, energy, or feeling.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicates the degree of strength of stains_Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having strength, power, or intensity less than average or expected.

Concepts.definition: Having strength, power, or intensity less than average or expected.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Straddling the dividing line between two categories.

Concepts.definition: Straddling the dividing line between two categories.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

Concepts.definition: No person or thing, nobody, not any.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Having strength, power, or intensity greater than average or expected.:The quality of being within reasonable or average limits; not excessive or extreme.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
